alert.note: Alert for Garza (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 02 at 5:00PM CDT until June 02 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lubbock has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Garza County in northwestern Texas... * Until 700 PM CDT. * At 500 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing very heavy rain moving east towards the warned area. Rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Some of this area received extremely heavy rain yesterday and is still flooded. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Post, Lake Alan Henry, Justiceburg and Southland. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
